name: market for miscanthus, chopped | miscanthus, chopped | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8768/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'miscanthus, chopped', in the Global geography.;In this market, expert judgement was used to develop product specific transport distance estimations;The product 'miscanthus, chopped' is a grain. It is an annual crop.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'miscanthus, chopped',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'miscanthus, chopped',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0129:Growing of other perennial crops

exchanges.description: This exchange refers to the variety Miscanthus giganteus, which is mainly grown as a biofuel.
